definitions.definition: a special right, advantage, or immunity granted or available only to a particular person or group of people.
examples: education is a right, not a privilege

definitions.definition: something regarded as a rare opportunity and bringing particular pleasure.
examples: I have the privilege of awarding you this scholarship
synonyms: pleasure "it was a privilege to meet her"

definitions.definition: (in a parliamentary context) the right to say or write something without the risk of incurring punishment or legal action for defamation.
examples: noun: absolute privilege; plural noun: absolute privileges

definitions.definition: the right of a lawyer or official to refuse to divulge confidential information.
a grant to an individual, corporation, or place of special rights or immunities, especially in the form of a franchise or monopoly.
grant a privilege or privileges to.
examples: English inheritance law privileged the eldest son

definitions.definition: exempt (someone) from a liability or obligation to which others are subject.
